title: torch.addmm is ambiguous
body_html:
matrix.addmm(0.1, t1, t2) is ambiguous if alpha=0.1 or beta=0.1

In fact, our type error messages describe both cases:

TypeError: addmm received an invalid combination of arguments - got (str, torch.FloatTensor, torch.FloatTensor), but expected one of:
...
 * (float beta, torch.FloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
 * (float alpha, torch.FloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
...
body_text:
matrix.addmm(0.1, t1, t2) is ambiguous if alpha=0.1 or beta=0.1
In fact, our type error messages describe both cases:
TypeError: addmm received an invalid combination of arguments - got (str, torch.FloatTensor, torch.FloatTensor), but expected one of:
...
 * (float beta, torch.FloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
 * (float alpha, torch.FloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
...
body:
`matrix.addmm(0.1, t1, t2)` is ambiguous if alpha=0.1 or beta=0.1

In fact, our type error messages describe both cases:

```
TypeError: addmm received an invalid combination of arguments - got (str, torch.FloatTensor, torch.FloatTensor), but expected one of:
...
 * (float beta, torch.FloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
 * (float alpha, torch.FloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
...
```
